section.title: Step 2. Define and Generate API Reference Outputs
API Reference Section or Chapter
section.para:
To generate an API reference chapter or section, you point to WADL files or elements from either a chapter or section in a DocBook XML file. The following API reference outputs are generated:
A roll-up table
Appears by default at the top of any chapter or section from where you point to WADL elements or files. Lists the HTTP method, URI, and description for all referenced methods.
A child section for each referenced resource
Shows a roll-up table of all referenced methods in the resource.
A grandchild section for each referenced method in each referenced resource
Shows a roll-up table for the method, followed by a detail description of the API method.
You point to WADL files or elements from either a chapter or section in a DocBook XML file, as follows:

simplesect.title: API Reference Chapter or Section from a WADL
simplesect.para: The simplest way to generate an API reference chapter or section is to point to an entire WADL file.
This approach requires little effort, but it limits your control over the organization of the reference chapter or section.
You can use this method at the chapter or section level only.

simplesect.title: API Reference Chapter or Section for Specified WADL Resources or Methods
simplesect.para: To have more fine-grained control over which resources appear in the output, you can mark up your DocBook XML file to pull in all the methods in some resources, or some methods in one or more specified resources.

section.title: Comprehensive Roll-up Table
section.para: To generate a comprehensive roll-up table, use the role="api-reference" attribute on a chapter or section element.

Typically, you use this attribute on a chapter element in a chapter that contains sections that reference WADL files or elements. You could also use this attribute on a section element in a section that contains child sections that reference WADL files or elements.

This attribute causes a comprehensive roll-up table to appear at the top of the chapter or section. The table shows all methods for any resources that are pointed to from the chapter or section and their child sections.

note.para: A comprehensive roll-up table appears by default in any section or chapter from where you point to a WADL file or elements.
If you also specify the role="api-reference" attribute in that same section or chapter, the roll-up table appears twice.
